author: dzhuliana
title: Automated mentor-matching tool
description: New members encounter a steep learning curve to understand where they fit and how they can add value and knowledge is not efficiently shared

f6_assessments.q0: Mentor-matching for Catalyst proposers is a useful service for new and established proposers alike. If carried out successfully, I can see how this helps to improve the experience of new members. As far as the actual challenge goals are concerned, this proposal only indirectly helps to fulfil the setting - as it does not by itself increase for example Townhall attendance or tooling for CAs, circle members etc. Creating adoption that can provide an AI matching tool with enough members to make useful fits would require enough volunteers to sign up, so user experience is likely to start low and increase over time. So putting this into a bigger project as additional tooling may have been better.
f6_assessments.q1:
OneUpOneDown is an existing mentoring app for women that has been used by a significant, but not large, number of users. Using modest funding to apply it to Catalyst should be possible, even easy. The proposers are a credible mix of experienced Project Catalyst participants and entrepreneurs from a tech company, so it is good to see them partnering. I have no doubt that the MVP can be delivered and improve the Catalyst experience of enough users to call the project a success.
The proposal is not presented very well and has a lot of formatting mishaps and links that do not work, so this makes me hesitate slightly that maybe the team is not serious or professional enough to do tech business adoption.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has good ideas for metrics and does give quantities that define success. I like to see how the numbers can be analyzed over the implementation period so the audit has a chance to identify problems early and give feedback or withhold funding if milestones are not matched. This is missing from the proposal. Otherwise I am confident that the numbers and percentages are in line with successful adoption at an early/MVP stage.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal identifies how new members face a steep learning curve and can find it hard to understand how best to fit in and utilise their skills within catalyst.

The team proposes to address this problem by affectively matching new members with mentors who understand their skills and can help them to on board in a productive way. Therefore effectively addressing this challenge. 

This would benefit the Cardano ecosystem by giving new members a sense of value and allowing their skills to be used to their best potential. 

As automated AI mentor matching software would be used to achieve this goal the project has the potential to add value and scale over time as the Cardano ecosystem grows by easily and quickly connecting mentors with mentees.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has already successfully implemented an AI powered mental matching platform “oneUpOneDown“ They intend to leverage this infrastructure to build out a catalyst mentoring pool. 

Alongside this they will also be collaborating with AIM and Catalyst School (both established catalyst community projects) to help achieve their goals.

There are clearly defined goals with measurable metrics allowing the community to audit the success of this project funded.

The team identifies recruiting mentors as one of the main risks to this proposal being implemented successfully.

They intend recruit through catalyst channels, groups and networks to onboard mentors and have the support of the Catalyst school and their OUOU’s program. 

If the pilot is successful. There is the intention to build a DAO on the Cardano blockchain to help reward and incentivise mentorship work. 

This would help address the identified problem if the project where to progress past the proposed pilot stage.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a clear and simple budget which seems reasonable to achieve the objectives set out for this four month project.
 
There are clearly defined goals with measurable metrics allowing this project to be easily auditable by the catalyst community. 

This proposal is for a pilot project. The aims of the project as a whole would have positive on boarding, education and comunity building benefits to project catalyst and Cardano. Therefore I believe the team both understand and address the challenge of new member onboarding.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal takes direct aim at attempting to improve assimilation of new users of Project Catalyst.  It has potential to move passive users in to voters and increase meaningful participation for proposers and a variety of other roles in Project. Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has laid out a descriptive and detailed timeline for the project.  It includes objectives and a clear roadmap.  The detailed budget and relevant experience of the team suggest sufficient knowledge of this content area to complete the proposal.  This team has already executed a working product and successfully created mentor matches according to their documents.  I believe it is highly likely the team can complete the proposal as presented.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal can be clearly audited using the team's proposed metrics of successfully matched mentors in this pilot project and evidence of a working technology in the automated mentor matching tool.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal definitely hits on the primary challenge areas however I believe this team could take this a step further to provide not just a mentor but a guide.  They could create distinct differences between guides (temporary) an mentors (long term).  As a strong Cardano enthusiast I have had to curate all my information myself and often the information needs to be sorted or requires significant time commitment.  The proposer seeks to impact both areas through a mentorship program utilizing an existing platform.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does a good job of outlining the major steps for success followed by a roadmap with distinct milestones.  The planning is well done.  The budget is sufficient however I would have preferred an hourly budget for the technical development.  It appears the proposer has a strong and committed team however without an hourly budget and scope of work I'm not entirely confident the accuracy of the budget.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provides clear and easy to track KPIs.  I suggest the proposer add a method of communicating the KPIs and progress (website, github, etc.).  In addition, I believe the proposer could have provided more KPIs (e.g. number of individuals contacted, number of individuals expressing interest, %conversion from interest to mentorship, etc.)  it would be very helpful to the Cardano community to understand how an uninformed person can transition to interested Cardano member.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal talks about how they will use AI to build trusting relationships in a large network through mentoring new members, in order to help new Catalyst members get directions. needed guidance to access the opportunities that are most relevant to them, confident in their ability to take on roles, take on more responsibilities, and develop deeper networks in the community. So it's perfectly suited to the challenge. In addition, this proposal also identifies risks and has plans to minimize these risks.
f6_assessments.q1: The project has a 7-step action plan to be implemented over a 4-month roadmap. The proposal budget for this project is $10,000, which is broken down into 4 fairly specific and detailed sub-categories. However, if the proposer explains in detail the content of these paid jobs to each hour of work, it will be easier to assess its reasonableness. The group has 3 main members with the cooperation of 2 organizations. main members have provided links to prove their own experience is relevant.
f6_assessments.q2: As mentioned in the feasibility study, the proposal has a roadmap with clear specific timelines. Specific KPI metrics is auditable.

f6_assessments.q0:
Having an AI powered tool to promote matching between mentors and mentees and optimize the way new members are inserted in Cardano defintely is a great idea and addresses the challenges as it makes the onboarding process much more smooth, quick and levarages communities capabilities. it also wil help challenge kpis as "Reduction in the number of unready proposals" and " Growth in the number of 4-5 star proposals", as it the proposals tend to be better with proper mentorship.

The solution is also well strucutured with value proposition very clear and number that attest solution quality (NPS over 80% and more than 200 matches). I also appreciate that the proposers already mention how they will communicate with the community in the risk management part. This is essential to make the tool widely used. For AI algorithm to work and improve over time, it needs plenty of data/users!

My main suggestions here would be to go through other mentorship programs in Cardano (maybe checking in past funds what was funded in this regard) to learn with them how they are working and maybe embed this tool in an existing program/platform, if possible. If there's a place where data is already available and people are using, it should be good to levarage this and not start from scratch. This would save time, money and effort in communication. I'd also add here how many people (mentors and mentees) will be involved in this pilot.
f6_assessments.q1:
the plan is sensible, realistic and delivers the solution in fast way. I liked it is included a feedback step in the timeline, this is essential to improve the tool and the process.

Budget breakdown is well done, with the costs broken down by month/timeline and role (how much will be paid for each person). It could just mention how many hours they would work.

Last, the team is already committed, with 3 people with the required competencies as software development, UI/UX, marketing, business and mentoring. 
There are also linkedin links to verify the information provided.

All in one, the project seems really feasilble.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are good selected kpis, most of them with target. I liked they divided the kpis in quality of the solution and in the impact (absolut numbers). 

the 2 goals in definitions of success also are sensible and will help to understand if project worked or not.

Last, I'd only consider adding here some main milestones related to project and tool developemt, to track the project when the tool is still not available.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposed team raises the problem that it is difficult for new members to understand where they fit in and how they add value and knowledge. They give a solution is to create an Automated mentor-matching tool. It is an AI-advisor combination software that builds trusting relationships through mentoring new members. Mentorship is a proven and well-suited tool for individuals by providing access to knowledge and networks. They propose developing a network matching pool to generate mentor-mentee matches between experienced and new members within Catalyst. This is very helpful for newbies. New people will be approached very quickly by interacting with the Catalyst community through the tool of mentorship. The proposed solution also provides 6 main components which are specific and clear to implement. In addition, they also introduce some risks such as a small number of CAs applying for the program and they offer a solution to reduce risks by promoting the benefits of being a mentor and recruiting through Catalyst channels, teams and their network. In addition, they also receive the support of Catalyst School. As such, they pose a problem and solve part of the challenge. I agree with this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
- The proposed action plan consists of 8 steps which are very clear. The roadmap will be implemented in 4 months and provide detailed work for each month such as: First month: Technical setup, mentoring and introduction of instructors; Second month: Matchmaking; 3rd month: Check-ins; Fourth month: Feedback and KPIs tracking. It's a good process.
- The cost of the project is described in a relatively simple manner, but specific expenditures have also been stated.
- The team has extensive experience in many fields such as program designers, technical team leaders, software engineers. At the same time, they have the support of 2 big projects, ""The project will be developed in collaboration with the AIM"" and ""Catalyst School"".
As analyzed above, I see that the project has a clear plan, roadmap, reasonable budget and appropriate professional team, so the project will be successful.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has given the measurement indicators such as: Quality of mentor matche; Impact on new member onboarding… with measurable metrics and goals. The project creates a highly effective mentor-matching tool in introducing new members to Catalyst. The project provides indicators that the community can evaluate.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is focusing on increase awareness of project catalyst, increase more meaningful participation and encouraging new members & support onboarding. Strong point to the team is they are already an established business with a existing userbase of +650 in over 20 countries – focusing on AI mentor matching to help new members with onboarding them.
The problem statement addresses a crucial topic of efficient onboarding – therefore the solution is AI based and proposes to leverage experienced members with new members of Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is a strong case, since the team has already experience in the processes. The proposal will focus on product development and pool-functionality as well as run a Catalyst pilot. Welcome approach to run a pilot since this is a crucial phase for the project to define further adjustments to tool and or processes.  Piloting with a focus group, gathering feedback and helpful insights – I would have liked to see a budget line for rewarding them; it also could help to ensure engagement in the first place. Interesting would have been some more details on where to source the new members – would they be identified via IDEASCALE new sign ups? Would this be the most efficient way to source them to the matching platform?

For implementing the project, they have strong program and mentoring experience, also teaming up with Cardano AIM – which have built several tools already for the community (voter tool, community advisor tool).
f6_assessments.q2: KPIs selected wisely tight to the core of what the project proposes, focusing on quality of mentor matches impact as well on new member onboarding. The given information on roadmap, metrics, clarity of problem statement and solution it is made transparent to be able to audit the proposal and measure its success.

f6_assessments.q0:
A well-formed and clear problem statement. The problem statement recognizes the value of the new members' knowledge, which is a benefit for doing outreach of this type.  Likewise, they realize that the extant (existing) knowledge in a community like Catalyst is held by senior members.  Understanding a problem like this, a mentor-matching tool is a clear solution. 

The solution is unique, innovative, and simple. Using existing software commercially developed by the team as a starting point, develop, build and implement a pilot mentor-matching program for Project Catalyst. 

The proposal has ideas for future scaling of the project to include, for example, a decentralized mentorship network / DAO with a token currency. For the proposed budget, this proposal has a high 'signal' to 'noise' ratio.  It is my opinion, mentorship will have a strong positive impact on the challenge's goals.  That being said, will mentors provide the service without incentive? money, or otherwise? A mentorship program will be effective in a close-knit and purpose-driven community like Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1: This is an existing team with a running product similar to the proposed solution.  Based on their LinkedIn profiles and 'One up, One down' business website, I am confident of professionalism and project success. The plan is straightforward. There is a step-by-step plan to implement the solution. The team values collaboration.  For example, they have the support of the Catalyst School, Cardano AIM, and several leaders in the Catalyst community.  The budget is reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a clear and detailed roadmap, by month, which will be easy to audit.   The KPIs are formatted in a professional way.  For example, they will measure the number of mentor matches and new roles performed by mentees.

f6_assessments.q0:
Although this proposal does not directly address the Challenge key metrics but I do highly acknowledge the indirect effect it will have towards this Challenge. Most specifically in increasing the proposals quality. Recently I have heard news that mentors are a position that is currently being push aside. Something I strongly disagree with, for mentors do equate to better quality proposals. Mentors act as quality gate keepers and to be frank we need that. I have already been through 3 scammish proposals that unfortunately takes time to address fairly, constructively and humanly possible.

What this proposal needs to do further is how to build a reputation system. The weakness of this AI pairing system is still in their dependence of manual/human input of mentors credentials. Which can be manipulated by mentors. If this AI can somehow, upfront, state or screen scammish credentials and block them, it will cement the benefit of this services. Workshops on how to submit a proposal can only do so much, but by direct mentoring by qualified, verified and committed individuals, it will highly effect the proposal in two ways. As prior mentioned, increasing the quality and reducing or highlighting scammish proposals.
f6_assessments.q1:
Seeing the CEO itself and their whole C-level team of this AI pairing system is involved and add to that, this is already an existing and working system, there is no doubt this proposal will achieve their goals. Rest assured the LinkedIn profiles provided does correlate with the individuals in this proposal.

The experiences of these individuals also translate well on how they approach the project planning of this proposal. It is clear, concise, easy to understand and most importantly correlates well with one another. From their action plan, roadmap to budget all interconnect and all further solidifies this projects high probability of achieving their goals.

In regards towards the amount asked and comparing that to the action that will be taken, the amount is surprisingly below the industry standard. Perhaps this is due to this project being multi-financed, meaning some development cost is covered by the company itself.

Ending on high note, it is great to see that they are addressing the potential risk they might face, which is low mentor turnout, by coordinating and collaborating with Catalyst School and Catalyst AIM.
f6_assessments.q2: There are indeed metrics they seek to share with the community but unfortunately the core metrics is more of a range and loose number. Besides that, other metrics has clear parameters and can be easily audited. Though the method on reporting their findings is not informed specifically. Reading their intent it will most likely involve the heavy use of surveys.

f6_assessments.q0: This will be a game-changer when implemented inside the Project Catalyst. It will help to smooth out the new member onboarding process. There's no doubt that some of us felt uncomfortable approaching a big crypto community for the first time even though we are very eager to contribute. This tool could break that obstacle, enabling new members to feel more comfortable and select the mentors based on their own criteria. Another advantage is the mentors will come from different countries with diverse culture, which in turn help to speed up Cardano's inclusion in the community.
f6_assessments.q1: Having collaboration with AIM & Catalyst School teams will boost the success likelihood of this project. The proposer and her team are running a legit business in the field (https://oneuponedown.org/). The budget and timeline are clearly mapped out. One minor thing that I believe should be provided in the proposal is the detailed information on the monthly Cardano program and experience support. What kind of initiatives or activities would be done to roll out this project. But overall, I hope this project can succeed.
f6_assessments.q2: The Auditability metric is well informed in the proposal with some KPIs and milestones. It would be better if the proposer & her team could make a dedicated channel (supporting AIM & Catalyst School) with the project progress and results. The whole Cardano community can also see the real impacts of this project.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal sets out a clear problem  related to the needs of the challenge by raising the issue for newcomers to find a place within the ecosystem and the difficulty of knowing where to find information.
Their solution to these problems is also clear and the positive impact within the community is explained and aware. 
“ new Catalyst members can receive the guidance they need to access the opportunities that are most relevant to them, gain confidence in their ability to participate in roles, take on more responsibility and deepen networks within the community.”
The KPIs are consistent with those of the challenge in the sense that the project aims to facilitate the integration of new members into the community.
This proposal is able to address future challenges as part of a global project and specifying its link to another team proposal: “ to fund the development of a white paper for Mentorship Incentivization DAO”
f6_assessments.q1: Each member of the team as well as their competence is well detailed, links are provided on their profiles and their experiences, as well as their collaborations in particular with Catalyst school in co-proposer. Their abilities seem to suit the demands of the project.The budget is very understandable, simplified and detailed at the same time, it seems coherent in order to accomplish the objectives. A detailed 8-step implementation plan provides and looks relevant over time. The fact that some members of the team already have experience in this area, being a member of the oneUponeDown organization, also attests to their aptitude. The team is also aware of the risks and clearly articulates their intended solution to address them by promoting the benefits of being a mentor, but also through their collaboration and the OUOU's program.
f6_assessments.q2: A roadmap with a very precise action plan is provided with the awareness that the team will adjust its results and objectives in an evolutionary way: “Tracking and analyzing the data in order to compile and present a clear view”: Signs of success are data in percentage of match success, of people able to take on roles of responsibility...they are therefore verifiable and make complete sense. Unless I am mistaken, I did not find any details on how the team plans to transcribe its results to the community, but overall the transparency and detail of this proposal allows us to deduce that the project itself is aware of this aspect and closely linked with the ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0: Having an AI driven mentor assignment tool is the approach this team brings to the problem stated by the challenge. I have a long experience looking over the onboarding process on large corporations and I see this fully answers it and can provide a lot of value especially for the second moment after arriving to Catalyst when people have already gained some understanding and wants to jump to action. The team is anticipating growth and risks and has foreseen how to address them.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposing team has relevant and significant experience in similar successful projects, they provide a well-structured and detailed plan. Both timeline and budget is also detailed and reasonable.
The team identifies the risk of not being able of bringing in enough mentors, they provide some actions, but it is unclear if they will consider mentorship to me an incentivized activity. In such case additional funding would be required.
f6_assessments.q2:
No specific KPIs are proposed but the team mentions data gathering and analyzing in a final stage where they will look at all the data and act accordingly.
The community will easily be able to track progress since there are clear milestones defined.

f6_assessments.q0: If there is something clear, it is that this platform is the future of humanity and sooner or later we will all have to enter this field. Since it is not easy to start from scratch in something that stores so much information, this is a proposal that fits perfectly with the idea of incorporating new members.
f6_assessments.q1:
I am really sure that this project will be a great success. Because it is an effective way to establish relationships that foster learning and enrichment for both people, apprentice and mentor.
The mentee will be able to gain a grounding in the field thanks to the knowledge of the mentor, and the mentor will broaden their experience in the sector.
It is also a safe method and the only risk that we can find, about the possibility that the registration of mentors is low, I think that it will be reduced as they observe that it is an experience that they also take advantage of.
It is necessary that people who start in this have a good base, advancing correctly in the matter, and I can't think of a better way to achieve it.
f6_assessments.q2:
The promoters offer us very complete information and a broad and detailed timeline. In addition, they have a well-trained team and the necessary motivation to carry out a project based on reciprocal cooperation.
The data provided makes me believe that the project will go ahead without any doubt.

solution: AI mentor matching software - building trusted relationships within a large network through mentorship to onboard new members.
experience: A company that has already built and has in production an AI mentor matching software.OneUpOneDown has 650+ users from over 20 countries and has been making automated mentor matches for 12+ months.
